title: Power dissipated as function of resistor property

content.prompt: The power dissipated in a wire carrying a constant electric current ğ¼ may be written as a function of ğ¼ , the length ğ“µ of the wire, the diameter ğ‘‘ of the wire, and the resistivity of ğ‘ of the material in the wire. skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
